snippet: While there were signs that financial conditions were improving, Christine Lagarde said those changes had not translated into improvements in the real economy.
abstract: International Monetary Fund managing director Christine Lagarde says global growth is likely to remain tepid in 2013 and central banks should keep their easy monetary policies in place.
lead_paragraph: While there were signs that financial conditions were improving, Christine Lagarde said those changes had not translated into improvements in the real economy.

headline.main: I.M.F. Director Urges Banks to Retain Loose Money Policy
headline.print_headline: I.M.F. Director Urges Banks To Retain Loose Money Policy
